seednet_fields.Institution Responsible for developing B: DIVISION OF VEGETABLE CROPS, IARI, NEW DELHI-12
seednet_fields.Parentage: A ROUND FRUITED F1 HYBRID DEVELOPED BY TWO GOOD COMBINING LINES OF BRINJAL.
seednet_fields.Adaptation and recommended ecology: RECOMMENDED FOR RLEASE AND CULTIVATION FOR NORTHERN & CENTRAL INDIA. 1. AUTUMN- WINTER CROP ( FROST- FREE WINTER); 2. SPRING-SUMMER CROP (SUMMER FREE OF LONG HOT DRY WINDS).
seednet_fields.Agronomic Features: PUSA HYB.6 IS RESPONSIVE TO BOTH NORMAL AND HIGHER FERTILITY STATUS SOILS BUT NOT POOR SOILS.
seednet_fields.General Morphological Characteristics: PLANT HEIGHT : 80 CM. PLANT NON- SPINY, SEMI-ERECT, VIGOROUS WITH PARTIAL PIGMENTATION ON YOUNGER LEAVES; FRUITS ROUND, GLOSSY WITH ATTRACTIVE PURPLE COLOUR HAVING PARTIALLY PIGMENTED STALK AND SEPALS, AVERAGE FRUIT WEIGHT 150-200 G.
seednet_fields.Reaction to Major Diseases: NO MAJOR DISEASE PROBLEM WAS ENCOUNTERED IN THE FIELD.
seednet_fields.Reaction to Major Pests: NO MAJOR PEST PROBLEM WAS SEEN IN THE FIELD. ROUTINE SCHEDULE FOR CONTROL OF PESTS IS RECOMMENDED PARTICULARLY IN AUGUST, SEPT. AND OCT., AGAINST FRUIT AND SHOOT BORER.

seednet_fields.Parentage: THE VARIETY HAS BEEN DEVELOPED THROUGH RECURRENT SELECTION BASED ON INDIVIDUAL PLANT PROGENY (HALF SIB) PERFORMANCE IN EC-243380 FROM ITALY.
seednet_fields.Adaptation and recommended ecology: THE VARIETY IS MOST SUITABLE FOR LOAMY AND BLACK COTTON SOILS HAVING PROPER DRAINAGE. DRY, COOL AND FROST-FREE CLIMATE IS FAVOURABLE FOR FENNEL.
seednet_fields.Specific Morphological Characteristics: SHORT STATURED WITH COMPACT UMBELS; LONG AND BOLD SEEDS; WHEN GREEN PRESENTS A DENSER VIEW OF THE PLANTS.
seednet_fields.General Morphological Characteristics: DAYS TO FLOWERING (DAYS) : 110.80; PLANT HEIGHT : 111.80 CM; NO. OF BRANCHES PER PLANT : 06.78; NO. OF UMBELS PER PLANT : 25.09; NO. OF UMBELLETS PER PLANT : 20.10; NO. OF SEEDS PER PLANT : 342.92; 1000-SEED WEIGHT (G) : 0.684; VOLATILE OIL CONTENT (%) : 01.90.
seednet_fields.Reaction to Major Diseases: THIS VARIETY IS MOST SUITABLE FOR IRRIGATED CONDITIONS. DISEASE INCIDENCE WAS AT PAR WITH RF-101 AND LOCAL.

seednet_fields.Parentage: CROSS BT PUSA PURPLE X PUSA KRANTI.
seednet_fields.Adaptation and recommended ecology: THIS VARIETY SUITABLE FOR CULTIVATION UNDER BRINJAL GROWING AREA OF GUJARAT
seednet_fields.Specific Morphological Characteristics: CALYX GREEN IN COLOUR WITH ROUGH SURFACE AND BIFURCATED ; WHITISH GREEN SMALL STAR LIKE STRUCTURE AT THE BOTTOM OF THE FRUITS.
seednet_fields.General Morphological Characteristics: PLANT HEIGHT : 60.8 CM ; FRUIT COLOUR : LIGHT PURPLE ; FRUIT SHAPE : MEDIUM LONG ; FRUIT SIZE : MEDIUM ; PLANT HABIT : SPREADING.
seednet_fields.Reaction to Major Diseases: THE LITTLE LEAF DISEASE INFECTION WAS FOUND LOWER IN THIS GENO-TYPE AS COMPARED TO CHECK VARIETY JUNAGARH LONG
seednet_fields.Reaction to Major Pests: THIS VARIETY SHOWED LOWER INCIDENCE OF JASSID WHITE FLY AND FRUIT BORER AS COMPARED TO CHECK J. LONG IN WHICH IT WAS 4.53, 7.40 AND 6.78% RESPECTIVELY.

seednet_fields.Institution Responsible for developing B: DIVISION OF VEGETABLE CROPS, IARI, NEW DELHI - 1100012
seednet_fields.Parentage: A LONG FRUITED F-1 HYBRID DEVELOPED FROM TWO GOOD COMBINING  LINES OF EGGPLANT.
seednet_fields.Resemblence to Variety: IT IS A F-1 HYBRID AND DOES NOT RESEMBLE  ANY VRIETY.
seednet_fields.Adaptation and recommended ecology: RECOMMENDED FOR RELEASE AND CULTIVATION IN DELHI, UP, PUNJAB AND ANDHRA PRADESH.1. AUTUMN- WINTER CROP AND 2. SORING SUMMER CROP OF CENTRAL GANGETIC PLAINS OF INDIA, NORMAL CROP OF KERALA, TAMIL NADU, KARNATAKA AND ANDHRA PRADESH.
seednet_fields.Agronomic Features: PUSA HYB. 5 IS RESPONSIVE TO BOTH HIGHER AND NORMAL FERTILITY STATUS OF SOILS. IT DOES NOT DO WELL IN  POOR SOILS.
seednet_fields.General Morphological Characteristics: PLANT HEIGHT : 95 CM. PLANT NON-SPINY WITH ERECT, BRANCHES HAVE PARTIAL PIGMENTATION ON YOUNGER LEAVES: FRUITS LONG, GLOSSY, ATTRACTIVE DARK PURPLE, PARTIALLY PIGMENTED PEDUNCLE, AVERAGE WEIGHT 100 GM
seednet_fields.Reaction to Major Diseases: NO MAJOR DISEASE PROBLEM WAS ENCOUNTERED IN THE FIELD.
seednet_fields.Reaction to Major Pests: NO MAJOR PEST PROBLEM WAS SEEN IN THE FIELD.

seednet_fields.Parentage: LOCAL COLLECTION FROM MUBAFFARPUR (BIHAR) SELFING AND INDIVIDUAL PLANT SELECTIONS WERE CARRIED OUT DEVELOP THE PROMISING LINE.
seednet_fields.Adaptation and recommended ecology: RECOMMENDED FOR GROWING IN THE NORTH PLAINS DURING SUMMER AND KHARIF SEASONS.
seednet_fields.Specific Morphological Characteristics: VEGETATIVE CHARACTERS - MEDIUM TO LONG VINE LENGTH, 5-6 BRANCHES, LEAVES DARK GREEN WITH LOBED MARGIN. FRUIT CHARACTERS - FRUITS DARK GREEN IN COLOUR, STRAIGHT, 20-25 CM IN LENGTH , NON-HAIRY, SKIN HARD SUITABLE FOR LONG DISTANCE TRANSPORTATION. LIGHT PINK FLESH
seednet_fields.General Morphological Characteristics: PLANT HEIGHT : 2.5- 3.0 M, HABIT TROPICAL, SUB TROPICAL, ANNUAL; VINE LARGE, NON-HAIRY AND SPREADING TYPE. DARK GREEN, SMALL IN SIZE WITH 6 LOBED MARGIN, NON-HAIRY, SMOOTH WITH LONG PETIOLES. FRUIT CHARACTER : FRUITS DARK GREEN, STRAIGHT, 20-25 CMS IN LENGHT, NON-HAIRY, SKIN HARD SUITABLE FOR LONG DISTANCE TRANSPORTATION; 8-10 FRUITS PER VINE.
seednet_fields.Reaction to Major Diseases: NO MAJOR INCIDENCE OF DISEASE WAS OBSERVED MORE FIELD TOLERANCE TO FRUIT FLY ATTACK THAN PUSA SUPRIYA.

seednet_fields.Institution Responsible for developing B: AGHARKAR RESEARCH INSTITURE, GG AGARKAR ROAD, PUNE 41004.
seednet_fields.Adaptation and recommended ecology: RECOMMENDED FOR RELEASE AND CULTIVATION IN THE STATES OF MAHARASHTRA, KARNATAKA AND TAMIL NADU UNDER TIMELY SOWING IRRIGATED CONDITIONS. MEDIUM MATURITY 107 DAYS. AVERAGE YIELD 48.50 -52.9 QTLS/HA
seednet_fields.Agronomic Features: CONSIDERING YIELD DATA UNDER AGRONOMICAL TRIALS IN PENINSULAR ZONE (POOLED BASIS), MACS 2971 SHOWED 5.1% GAIN OVER BEST DICOCCUM CHECK, DDK 1029. GRAINS ARE BOLD WITH COMPARATIVELY LOW SEDIMENTATION VALUE (20 ML) AND HIGH PROTEIN CONTENT (12.9).
seednet_fields.General Morphological Characteristics: PLANT HEIGHT: 89.5CM, GROWTH HAVIT : SEMI-ERECT, COLEOPTILE : PRESENT, AURICLE : ABSENT LEAF SHEATH : ABSENT STRAW COLOUR : WHITE COLOUR AT MATURITY : WHITE, AVG. 1000 GRAIN WT. 40.8
seednet_fields.Reaction to Major Diseases: * THE PROPOSED VARIETY MACS 2971 POSSESSES HIGHER LEVEL OF TOLERANCE AGAINST BROWN RUST AS ITS MAXIMUM SCORE UNDER ARTIFICIAL CONDITIONS NEVER EXCEEDED BEYOND 10 MS( ACI 0.6-1.7) IN ALL THE THREE YEARS TESTING IN COMPARISION TO DDK 1029 (HS 30S; ACI 2.6 - 10.8).* FOR STEM RUST MACS 2971 SHOWED ACI BETWEEN 1.8 TO 11.1 AND WAS WITHIN ACCEPTABLE LIMIT IN COMPARISON WITH CHECKS AND QUALIFYING VARIETIES. * THE AVERAGE INCIDENCE TO FOLIAR BLIGHT, POWDERY MILDEW AND HEAD SCAB ALSO COMPARATIVELY LOW IN THE PROPOSED VARIETY MACS 2971 .

seednet_fields.Institution Responsible for developing B: DEPARTMENT OF RICE, CENTRE FOR PLANT BREEDING & GENETICS, TNAU, COIMBATORE 641 003.
seednet_fields.Parentage: CO (R) 49 IS A HYBRID DERIVATIVE OF THE CROSS C 20/RNR 52147 EFFECTED DURING KHARIF 1996 AND STABILIZED IN F 4GENERATION DURING KHARIF 1999.
seednet_fields.Adaptation and recommended ecology: IRRIGATED CONDITION AS A TRANSPLANTED CROP IN LATE SAMBA/ THALADI SEASON ( SEPT. - OCT. SOWING)
seednet_fields.Agronomic Features: CO (R) 49 (CB 99019) WAS EVALUATED UNDER SRI SYSTEM OF RICE CULTIVATION IN RABI 2006--07 AT COIMBATORE. THE CULTURE RECORDED HIGHER GRAIN YIELD UNDER SRI THAN THE NORMAL METHOD AND ALSO OVER THE CHECK VARIETY, BPT 5204. NON LODGING NON SHATTERING HIGH TILLERING ABILITY SUITABLE FOR LATE SAMBA AND THALADI SEASON (SEP-OCT SOWING) AS TRANSPLANTED CROP IN TAMIL NADU. THE REICE VARIETY CO (R) 49 HAS MEDIUM SLENDER WHITE GRAIN TYPE WITH GOOD MILLING PERCENTAGE (72.3%) AND HEAD RICE. THIS VARIETY POSSESSES INTERMEDIATE AMYLOSE AND INTERMEDIATE GELATINIZATION TEMPERATURE WHICH ARE THE DESIRABLE TRAITS FOR GOOD COOKING QUALITY.
seednet_fields.Specific Morphological Characteristics: 1. EXERTED DROOPY COMPACT PANICLES 2. MEDIUM SLENDER WHITE RICE
seednet_fields.General Morphological Characteristics: PLANT HEIGHT : 85-90 CM, GOOD EARLY PLANT VIGOUR : GREEN, COLEOPTILE : GREEN, BASAL LEAF SHEATH COLOUR : GREEN, LEAF BLADE COLOUR: GREEN, LEAF PUBESCENCE INTERMEDIATE, LEAF LENGTH : 45.0 CM (+ 5.0 MM) LEAF WIDTH : 1.50 CM  (+ 0.2 MM) DAYS TO 50% FLOWERING : 100-105 DAYS PANICLE EXERTION : WELL-EXERTED PANICLE  DAYS TO MATURITY (DAYS) : 135  DAYS SEED ACOAT (KERNEL ) COLOUR : WHITE 1000 GRAIN WEIGHT (G) 15.9, GRAIN MEDIUM SLENDER RICE GRADE : MEDIUM SLENDER MILLED RICE COLOUR : WHITE ABDOMINAL WHITE : OCCASIONALLY PRESENT,
seednet_fields.Reaction to Stress: ABIOTIC -NOT TESTED BIOTIC- REACTION TO PESTS AND DISEASES FURNISHED IN PARA 12 (A) AND 12 (B)
seednet_fields.Reaction to Major Diseases: THE CULTURE CB 99019 WAS SCREENED AGAINST ALL THE FIVE EPIDEMIC DISEASES VIZ., BLAST, BACTERIAL BLIGHT, SHEATH ROT, SHEATH LIGHT AND RICE TUNGRO DISEASE (RTD) UNDER ARTIFICIALLY INOCULATED CONDITIONS DURING 2004-05,2005-06 AND 2007 -08. THE CULTURE CB 99019 IS FOUND TO BE MODERATELY RESISTANT TO BLAST (5), BACTERIAL LEAF BLIGHT (5) AS AGAINST BPT 5204 (7&9)
seednet_fields.Reaction to Major Pests: THE CULTURE CB 99019 WAS EVALUATED FOR THREE YEARS (2005-08 ) AT COIMBATORE, MADURAI ANDADUTHURAI AGAINST THE MAJOR PESTS AND WAS FOUND TO BE MODERATELY RESISTANT TO YELLOW STEM BORER (3), GLH (3) AS AGAINST BT 5204 (7&9)

seednet_fields.Adaptation and recommended ecology: SUITABLE FOR CULTIVATION AFTER PADDY HARVEST WITH LIMITED IRRIGATED CONDITIONS (1-2 IRRIGATION), SOWN IN LIGHT/MEDIUM SANDY LOAM SOILS.
seednet_fields.Agronomic Features: THE PROPOSED STRAIN HAS RESISTANCE FOR LODGING AND SHATTERING. SUITABLE FOR CULTIOVATION UNDER AFTER/RELAY CROPPING IN PADDY FIELD WITH COM- UP/FULL IRRIGATION. THE NORMAL AGRONOMY PRACTICES LIKE USE OF 7 KG/HA SEED (33% HIGHER SEED RATE) WITH PARTIAL FERTILIZER DOSES OF (50:25:25 NPK KG/HA) WITH COME UP IRRIGATION AND FULL IRRIGATIONS. MEAN OIL CONTENT 37.48% WITH RANGE OF 35.8 TO 40.1% OIL CONTENT IN DIFFERENT LOCATIONS.
seednet_fields.General Morphological Characteristics: PLANT HEIGHT : 140 CM (115-168) APPRISED SILIQUAE , HEADING DAYS : 20 DAYS
seednet_fields.Reaction to Stress: THIS VARIETY CAN PERFORM WELL UNDER RESTRICTED IRRIGATIONS
seednet_fields.Reaction to Major Diseases: RESISTANCE TO FOLIAR DISEASES SUCH AS WHITE RUST AND POWDERY MILDEW UNDER FIELD CONDITIONS.
seednet_fields.Reaction to Major Pests: PROPOSED STRAIN COMPARATIVELY LESS IN INFECTIONS OF APHID WHICH COULD BE EASILY CONTROLLED BY RECOMMENDED PLANT PROTECTION MEASURES.

seednet_fields.Parentage: The proposed variety has been developed from a cross CN 1216 X CN 1131-4-4-1-4. Both the parents are pre-breeding materials developed under Shuttle Breeding programme of International Rice Research Institute (IRRI).
seednet_fields.Adaptation and recommended ecology: The variety may be recommended for Kharif season under rainfed low land condition.
seednet_fields.Agronomic Features: Seed rate is 40 kg/ha (2-3 seedlings per hill)
seednet_fields.Reaction to Major Diseases: Disease infection was below the threshold level for the proposed variety AAU-KMJ Dhan-46 (Surma Dhan) at RARS, Karimganj, Assam during kharif 2018 and 2019. Under field screening without artificial inoculation the proposed variety showed Resistant to highly Resistant reaction in respect of False smut and Neck blast diseases, Resistant against Brown spot and Highly Resistant reaction in respect of False smut and Neck blast diseases, Resistant against Brown spot and Highly reaction against BLB
seednet_fields.Reaction to Major Pests: Under field screening without artificial inoculation the proposed variety, AAU-KMJ Dhan-46 (Surma Dhan) showed White Ear Heads (WEH) to the extent of 0.6-0.8% panicles (Score-)) indicating its Highly Resistant reaction against Stem borer. Similarly, it showed neglible damage (Score-0) in respect of Leaf folder (HR) and very slight injury (Score-1) in respect to BPH and GLH indicating Highly Resistant reactions against these two pests
seednet_fields.Fertiliser Dosage (Kg/Ha):
60:20:40 kg/ha of N:P2O5:K2O
Basal: ½ N+ Full P2O5+3/4K2O
1st topdressing: ¼ N + ¼ K2O at 30-35 DAT
2nd topdreesing: ¼ N at Panicle initiation stage

basic_info.institution: ICAR- AICRP on Rice, Regional Agricultural Research Station, Assam Agricultural University
